column4: no, but if we're distributing a script whose sole purpose is to get these codecs and do nothing else (let alone with our installer ...), then that's still no good.
hm, not seen that.  which CD are you using, the RC?
we'd need the exact error to debug any further, I'm afraid.
is this different from debian msttcorefonts, flash, real installers?
yes, because they merely have a licence which states that we can't redistribute it; we're not violating anyone's patents by having people downloda it.
you must download this from our website != you must not use this
ok. mp3 is not real (pun accidental)
we need something like plf is doing for mandrake
right. copyleft is copyright, and a license is a license is a license. except some licenses are better than others :)
oh, so they have upgraded from 2.2 already? =)
not in the least.
as I said before, all cards are fully supported with 2D, and the 3D support ranges up reasonably.
you're right
will moving to x.org be a disaster for those who track hoary?
absolutely not.  if your configuration doesn't get migrated perfectly, or if there are any regressions, you get to report a bug
i mean the transition from xfree to x.org -- is it very painful?
if it is, you get to report a bug
put it this way -- if my mum dist-upgrades to hoary, she shouldn't notice
nicely put =)
anyway, i'm already ready to congratulate everybody for such a small amount of hassle with these early days of hoary, which by all reason should have been a damn mess =)
if you have ubuntu-desktop installed, xserver-xorg will be automatically installed
